statement.para: The elementary matrix E_{ij}(s) allows us to perform the row operation ‘add t times the j-th row of an (n,p)-matrix \Mtrx{B} to the i-th row of \Mtrx{B}’. In symbols:

math.display.latex: \begin{bmatrix} 1 & \cdots & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots & t & \vdots \\ 0 & \cdots & 1 & \cdots & 0 \\ \vdots & & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ 0 & \cdots & 0 & \cdots & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} * & \cdots & * \\ \vdots & & \vdots \\ a_{i1} & \cdots & a_{ip} \\ \vdots & & \vdots \\ a_{j1} & \cdots & a_{jp} \\ \vdots & & \vdots \\ {*} & \cdots & * \end{bmatrix}\ =\ \begin{bmatrix} * & \cdots & * \\ \vdots & & \vdots \\ a_{i1}+ta_{j1} & \cdots & a_{ip}+ta_{jp} \\ \vdots & & \vdots \\ a_{j1} & \cdots & a_{jp} \\ \vdots & & \vdots \\ {*} & \cdots & * \end{bmatrix}
